observations: The first and last rows are unchanged.
The colored blocks are present on the left and right edges.
The blocks' shapes are altered on the right sides. The right blocks fill the rightmost columns and the left side retains original values.
In example 1, '1' replaces '7' and '3' replaces '7', '9' replaces '7'.
In example 3, '2' replaces '7', '4' replaces '7', '3' replaces '7', '6' replaces '7'.
hypotheses: The left side of the input grid remains the same. The right-side color patterns replace the original elements with the color of their respective block.
The input grid's right side is filled with the border color of a rectangle based on the input, while the remaining portion of grid is invariant.
selected_rule: The left side of the input grid remains the same. The right-side color patterns replace the original elements with the color of their respective block.
step_plan: Copy the left side of input grid to the output grid.
Copy right most elements from right blocks to replace original elements on the right side of the output grid based on location from respective blocks.
